thread.title: Anglo-Welsh rivalry is still in rude health
thread.title_full: Anglo-Welsh rivalry is still in rude health - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Anglo-Welsh rivalry is still in rude health
text: The date: 19 February 1881. The place: Richardson’s Field, Blackheath, London. The occasion: the first international rugby match between England and Wales. Who could have envisaged then that the rivalry would last more than 130 years? Here, we compare their records and recall some of the great names from the past: Divided in battle, united by Vitality We love sport and its power to inspire healthier lives. That’s why we’re the Official Wellness Partner of England Rugby (RFU) and the Welsh Rugby Union, for both men’s and women’s teams. “There is natural alignment between RFU and Vitality, a brand that is a progressive market leader in the promotion of health and wellness amongst its members,” says RFU Chief Commercial and Marketing Officer, Sophie Goldschmidt. “Health and wellbeing is a huge part of my life,” says Wales wing Alex Cuthbert, “from what I eat to how I train. I’m delighted we have Vitality on board as our Wellness partner.” • For more information on health and lifestyle, visit vitality.com
